net.dean.jraw.http

Class HttpLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.HttpLogger

  • public class HttpLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for logging objects relating to HTTP network activity, particularly the HttpRequest and RestResponse classes. The parts of the request and response are broken into parts called components. To enable or disable a Component, you can use enable(Component) or disable(Component) respectively.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HttpLogger.Component
      Represents the components involved in logging an HTTP request and response

        Returns:

      • log

        public void log(HttpRequest r)
        Logs an HTTP request in this format: 
        $method $url
     form-data: {$key1=$val2,
                 $key2=$val2}
     headers: {$key1: $val1}
        Where $requestDescriptor is the combination of the HTTP method and URL (ex: "POST http://www.example.com").
        Parameters:
        r - The request to log

      • log

        public void log(HttpRequest r,
       boolean wasSuccessful)
        Logs an HTTP request in this format: 
        $method $url
     form-data: {$key1=$val2,
                 $key2=$val2}
     headers: {$key1: $val1}
        Where $requestDescriptor is the combination of the HTTP method and URL (ex: "POST http://www.example.com").
        Parameters:
        r - The request to log
        wasSuccessful - If true, then the message will be logged at INFO, otherwise ERROR.

      • log

        public void log(RestResponse r)
        Logs an HTTP response in this format: 
        $protocol $code $message
     headers: {$key1: $val1,
               $key2: $val2}
        Parameters:
        r - The response to log

      • setResponseBodyAlwaysFull

        public void setResponseBodyAlwaysFull(boolean flag)
        Sets whether or not to always log the full response body, regardless of the request's success. If this component is disabled, the body will be trimmed and an ellipsis will be appended.
        See Also:
        ELLIPSIS

      • isResponseBodyAlwaysFull

        public boolean isResponseBodyAlwaysFull()
        Whether or not to always log the full response body, regardless of the request's success. If this component is disabled, the body will be trimmed and an ellipsis will be appended.
        See Also:
        ELLIPSIS
